page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF UPWEY
page.content: {UPWEY}IS LOCATED JUST TO THE NORTH OF WEYMOUTH WHICH IS SOUTH DORSET'S PREMIER RESORT TOWN. THE MAIN ROADWAY THROUGH THE AREA LEADS FROM WEYMOUTH TO DORCHESTER AND IT FORMS THE FOCUS OF MOST OF THE URBAN ACTIVITY. THE BULK OF THE BLOCK IS TAKEN UP WITH {AGRICULTURAL ACTIVITES}OF ONE KIND OR ANOTHER, AND THE WHOLE AREA IS BEST DESCRIBED AS "RURAL". THE VILLAGE ITSELF CONTAINS SEVERAL FEATURES OF NOTE SUCH AS THE{WISHING } {WELL}ON THE SMALL RIVER WEY THE OLD MANOR AT{WESTBROOK HOUSE}AND THE FLOUR{MILL}WHICH IN FACT FEATURED IN ONE OF{THOMAS HARDY'S NOVELS.} THERE IS LITTLE IN THE WAY OF SHOPPING OR ENTERTAINMENT FACILITIES, AND MOST OF THE LOCAL PEOPLE WORK OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE IN WEYMOUTH OR DORCHESTER.
